bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, September 18, 1904

div1.p: Carter describes his daily life and his work.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, September 18, 1904

opener.dateline:
Ancon, Canal Zone,
Isthmus of Panama,
Sept 18/04

div1.p:
There was no steamer to N. O. this (last) week.
So no extra letter was possible. I have had so busy a
week that I could scarcely have written, at any rate written
much, anyway, I am going to Guyaquil either
Tuesday or Friday on business, & if I can do so will take
go to Quito for pleasure while there, I suppose you
know something about Quito; that it is on the equa-
tor, but is cool, always - about our October cli-
mate- It is the highest city in the world
I mean in altitude, It is about 3 1/2 days to Guyaquil, I
will have to stay there about 4 or 6 days. You will then
miss your next week's letter & possibly two, Do
not be uneasy, because I will leave orders with
Pierce or Perry to Cable if there be anything the
matter & I am going to see about the Quarantine work
there, I surely wish you were here we would go together
The sea trip you would not mind & I know how you en-
joy out going to out of the way places, The fare however
is enormous- $80. to Guyaquil - & while I can get a pass
it is not easy to do, 1/2 fare is not so hard to obtain.
If you were here now however we w'd
see Quito together. Later- I may
have to go to Callao - the part of Lima, but not
for 4 to 6 months.

Mr Barrett's reception was a success - I did not enclose
the paper work to Ned, but if I can find it will do
so-. He is a fairly pleasant man but an ass,-or at
least a poseur & extremely self conscious. I under-
stand thoroughly his “promotion” from the Argentina to
Panama. Ancient social affairs - of which I am on the
outskirts just close enough to hear rumors - there
is an organization here “la Club Iris”- the “U” is
very long & the “i”s are double “e”s - of young girls, etc.
President of which is Elisa Espinosa, Miss E., with her
sisters & two cousins-“the Leferre girls” went to Notre Dame
in Balt. & are very American. They had a grand function
a few days ago - & there were two prices - a “Gran Prix” & a
little one - Prizes cancealed in small bags of candy & dis-
tributed by lot. AnTwo girls, not a members of the club-
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ISTHMIAN CANAL COMMISSION
CANAL ZONE
Rear Admiral JOHN G. WALKER,
United States Navy, CHAIRMAN.
Major General GEORGE W. DAVIS,
United States Army.
WILLIAM BARCLAY PARSON, C. E.
WILLIAM H. BURR, C. E.
BENJAMIN M. HARROD, C. E.
C. EWALD CRUNSKY, C. E.
MR. FRANK J. HECKER.
attended, there are 40 members-, & one
of them got the “Gran Prix.” It was an ex-
tremely outraged party of damsels & “the girl was
so frightened that as the hostile demonstrations that
she denied having the prize - a breast pin - although, she
had shown & boasted of it. The reason I write all
this rigamarole is for Miss. E's speech in telling
of it. ”Aftare all of the wurruk wee 'ave done for
thee club here comes Miss Butt-in-sky
an takes the Gran Prix! There is no question that Miss E. had been in the U. S.

We have moved- “from the large building-which is now being
fitted up for quarters for Gorgas & myself- to a small to
cottage- not so small- formerly the priest's house where”
Ross: Lyster (G's nephew) & myself are domiciled. It is
pleasanter than at the old place, because none of us
quarrel & are on good terms with one another - which
is more than has been the case lately at the hospi-
tal, We are still eating at the hospital mess, but will
start a mess very shortly - but which will so far as I am
concerned last but a fewshort time I hope.

I enclose herewith 20: “medias”- worth 2 1/2 cents each - a little less-
C1
B22
which I think have decorative possibilities - What do
you think. A dollar can get 4242 of them: Can they be made
into a bracelet or used as a trimming - 42 go to a dollar,
There is a gold coin - about the same size - or half the size ra
rather - a “Colon” - of Costa Rica- which cost 50 cents each-
How would they do in combination? Say a stout
Silver band with medias strung at intervals for one
bracelet & a gold one in the Colones? One It is of brace-
lets I am thinking- The effect might be somewhat
barbaric, but would be pretty I think, One would not
use the Colones as trimming.

We have just been talking-& want to ask you what
is the 2d line of Julia Wards Howe's “Battle Hymn”
"I have listened to the trumpet which shall.... retreat,
Here is the forgotten line
“My soul be swift to meet him be jubilant my feet.”
Also the 2d line in the last verse.
“In the beauty. etc - - - - across the sea.”
2d line
“As he died - - - - - - to make men free”

I cannot answer your mothers question until I go to the
office tomorrow, because I forgot the date she wishes to
go to Norfolk, I will say that I have written to everyone

I can think of to get cheap rates via Havana; I expect to do what
I can to come that route. If I cannot I will come anyway &
we will discuss. it & unless we think
the P. W. cannot take the journey we
will come same way. If she cannot
I will. “chuck the job” as soon as I can
without losing the effect of my work & come
home to stay home. "
